benchmark_details.name: EgoThink
benchmark_details.overview: EgoThink is a novel visual question-answering benchmark designed to evaluate the first-person perspective thinking capability of vision-language models (VLMs) across six core capabilities and twelve dimensions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the thinking capability of vision-language models from a first-person perspective.

data.source: Selected clips from the Ego4D video dataset, manually annotated with question-answer pairs.
data.annotation: Annotated by six annotators with three additional reviewers ensuring quality.

methods: Automated metrics using GPT-4 for scoring
metrics: Pearson correlation with human evaluation, Accuracy
methodology.calculation: Evaluation scores are computed based on outputs compared to reference answers.
methodology.interpretation: Scores are derived from a scale of 0 (wrong), 0.5 (partially correct), to 1 (correct).
methodology.baseline_results: Performance across various VLMs remains below optimal, with top scores around 60 points.
methodology.validation: Comparative evaluations against a broad array of vision-language models.
